ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Portable software-defined radio transmission and experimentation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Portable RF signal generation â€¢ WiFi hotspot creation â€¢ Web browser control â€¢ Multiple transmission modes (FM, FT8, RTTY, etc.) â€¢ Amateur radio experimentation
ðŸ“– Summary: PIrateRF transforms a Raspberry Pi Zero W into a portable RF signal generator and WiFi hotspot. It allows users to control various transmission modes, from FM broadcasts to digital modes, through a web browser, enabling experimentation and education in software-defined radio transmission.

ðŸ’¡ raspap-webgui | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating a wireless access point and router using Raspberry Pi or other Debian-based devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Wireless router setup â€¢ Web-based management interface â€¢ DHCP settings â€¢ WireGuard support â€¢ OpenVPN support
ðŸ“– Summary: RaspAP is a PHP-based software solution designed to transform Debian-based devices, particularly Raspberry Pi, into full-featured wireless routers. It offers a user-friendly web interface for managing network settings, including DHCP, VPN (WireGuard, OpenVPN, Tailscale), SSL, ad blocking, and captive portal integration.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ paru | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simplifying AUR package management for Arch Linux users.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AUR package installation and upgrades â€¢ pacman wrapper â€¢ Minimal user interaction â€¢ Color support (follows pacman configuration) â€¢ File-based review with file manager integration
ðŸ“– Summary: Paru is a feature-rich AUR helper written in Rust for Arch Linux. It simplifies the process of searching, installing, and upgrading packages from the Arch User Repository (AUR) by wrapping pacman with added functionality and minimal user interaction.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ iOS-OCR-Server | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Turning an iOS device into a local OCR server for text recognition in images.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Local OCR processing using Apple's Vision Framework â€¢ No cloud dependencies â€¢ Unlimited usage â€¢ Privacy-focused â€¢ API for integration into other applications
ðŸ“– Summary: The iOS-OCR-Server repository provides a way to turn an iOS device into a local OCR server using Apple's Vision Framework. It allows users to perform OCR on images without relying on cloud services, ensuring privacy and unlimited usage. The server exposes an API that can be integrated into other applications for text recognition.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ systeminformer | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: System monitoring, debugging, and malware detection on Windows systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Detailed overview of system activity with highlighting â€¢ Graphs and statistics for tracking resource usage â€¢ Identifying processes using specific files â€¢ Managing active network connections â€¢ Real-time information on disk access
ðŸ“– Summary: System Informer is a free, powerful tool for monitoring system resources, debugging software, and detecting malware on Windows. It provides a detailed overview of system activity, allowing users to track resource usage, identify processes using specific files, manage network connections, and analyze stack traces.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ motia | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simplifying backend development by unifying various backend functionalities into a single framework, reducing the complexity of managing multiple separate systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Unifies APIs, background jobs, workflows, and AI Agents â€¢ Built-in observability and state management â€¢ Multi-language support (JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Ruby)
ðŸ“– Summary: Motia is a multi-language backend framework designed to unify APIs, background jobs, workflows, and AI Agents into a single core primitive, simplifying backend development. It aims to eliminate runtime fragmentation by providing built-in observability and state management, supporting languages like JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, and Ruby.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ PolymarketViewer | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Browsing and interacting with Polymarket prediction markets on Android devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Browse active prediction market events â€¢ Filter events by category and search â€¢ Sort events by various criteria â€¢ View detailed event information â€¢ Display interactive price history charts
ðŸ“– Summary: Polymarket Viewer is an Android application for browsing prediction markets on Polymarket.com. It provides features to browse, filter, sort, and view detailed information about prediction market events, including price history charts and comments.
